conversation.thought:
As Parent_D, my goal is to secure my highest possible preference. My true preference list starts with Nursery_D. Since this is Round 1, the optimal strategy in the Parent-Proposing Deferred Acceptance framework is to propose to my absolute top choice, Nursery_D, regardless of my priority ranking there, as this maximizes my chance of securing my best outcome.

I must analyze the competition based on known preferences:
*   Parent_A wants N_B (Rank 1).
*   Parent_B wants N_A (Rank 1).
*   Parent_C wants N_C (Rank 1).
*   Parent_D wants N_D (Rank 1).
*   Parent_E wants N_E (Rank 1).

If all parents apply to their top choice in Round 1, each nursery receives exactly one application. Since Nursery_D receives an application only from Parent_D, and Parent_D is acceptable to Nursery_D (all parents are acceptable), Nursery_D will accept Parent_D. This results in a stable match where Parent_D secures their rank 1 choice immediately.
